entry.title: Without You, I Don't Know How To Be
entry.summary:
Author: adhdghost

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,239Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 15

Summary: Eddie, or Mr Diaz, as he’s currently being referred to, is in the middle of teaching 11th graders about the cold war when he feels it. At first, he thought he was imagining things, but then books are falling from high shelves and the projector is coming down- thankfully not landing on any students. He could not believe his luck- his first day at work in a new state and there is an earthquake. His brain immediately returns to a common topic that he thinks about - his family.His son, Christopher, and his husband, Buck, are also having their first days and all Eddie can do is worry-or;teacher!eddie is a chronic worrier, and worries when his husband, who just started working at the 118, doesn't call him back.(5 times Eddie worries about his husband at work, and one time he can worry about him at home)

entry.title: My Beloved Ghost and Me.
entry.summary:
Author: daggerandrosie

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,906Chapters: 1/7Kudos: 0

Summary: “Listen Buckley, I need you to know that this whole…” The officer gestured to Evans' clothes. “Gothics United Against Following Curfew club you're a part of can end up real bad, you can die kid. Or worse, go to jail.”Evan doesn't think he looks much like a goth, aside from wearing black, and he only does it because it's easier to sneak around like that, there's nothing about him… Scratch that. Officer Gallagher just found him lurking around the cemetery at two in the morning. Because he talks to ghosts.Always have and probably always will.It fucking sucks.It sucks. so. bad.And now he has one. A ghost. In his room. A very handsome one at that, an old cowboy with a cowboy hat, tight pants, boots and big brown eyes.Evan is so, so, very fucked

entry.title: Say Your Prayers
entry.summary:
Author: pinkysparkles

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,897Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 0

Summary: “Move, let me see him.” Eddie chokes on his breath as he falls to his knees and wipes a stripe of blood from Buck’s face. Those cheeks that had been red with embarrassment this morning, now stained with pain and grief. Buck flinches slightly at the touch - barely - but it is enough. He’s alive. ——— (Or, as Buck and Eddie navigate their feelings being roommates, a whirlwind of events on a call cause Eddie’s return to the team under not so great circumstances. Or should he say Buck was under said circumstances. AKA a building collapse.)(Or, or, Bobby’s alive, Buck and Eddie are roommates, this is a rewrite of the season finale but the way I thought it would go.)

entry.title: I'm a little much for everyone
entry.summary:
Author: Junniejk

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,686Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: „What is it then, huh?“ Eddie asks, getting up as well to be on the same level as him. „Why did you put in for a transfer?“ Buck looks at him, breathing heavily, contemplating if he really wants to say it, reveal his innermost feelings. In the end it feels like he doesn’t have any other choice, knowing that Eddie won’t let up otherwise.„Because I don’t have anybody left.“ It physically pains him to say the words out loud but his voice is surprisingly steady albeit the bitterness that swings with in them.------What if Buck and Eddie were the ones trapped in the collapsed building right after Buck revealed that he put in for a transfer?or, 8x18 fix-it fic that’s just highly dramatic and Buck is really going through it.

entry.title: Through Fire and Time II (9-1-1 x 9-1-1: Lone Star Fanfic)
entry.summary:
Author: actuallynate

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 61,228Chapters: 16/32Kudos: 38

Summary: Same number, different city.Elliot "Eli" Hayes thought he had found stability and belonging with the 126 in Austin - a firehouse that helped him heal from his past and grow into his role as a paramedic. But life, as unpredictable as ever, throws him a curveball when a sudden reshuffle forces him to temporarily leave the comfort of the firehouse family and take up a position with the 118 in Los Angeles.Returning to his hometown stirs up old memories, unresolved grief, and unexpected challenges. With his panic disorder still a lingering shadow, Eli must navigate the dynamic and high-pressure environment of the 118 while proving himself to a new team.Meanwhile, his close friend, Ravi Panikkar, struggles to find his footing at the 252 firehouse in New York under the shadow of Captain Sal Deluca, a once respected leader whose toxic ways threaten to unravel Ravi's confidence and safety.TRIGGER WARNING: This story contains themes of panic disorder, hypochondria, and anxiety attacks, as well as references to trauma, medical procedures, suicide, drug names and high-stress emergency situations. Reader discretion is advised.

entry.title: a very common crisis
entry.summary:
Author: oneofthesirens

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,073Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 81

Summary: “I’m mortified, Eddie, I really thought Buck would have talked to you about it,” Maddie says. She looks genuinely regretful, her eyebrows pulling together with concern. “Obviously, he clarified things for me, told me that he wasn’t pining for his straight best friend, and I’m just…I’m so sorry. It wasn’t my place to speculate on your relationship like that.” There must be a worm that’s wrapped itself around his thoughts — that’s constrained his neural pathways to just the thought of Buck’s in love with you — because something takes over Eddie’s mouth. Something entirely foreign and jarring prompts him to say with too much incredulity: “Buck said he wasn’t in love with me?” Maddie gapes at him. Eddie snaps his mouth shut with so much force his teeth click. or: Maddie tells Eddie about the conversation she had with Buck. Eddie spirals about it.

entry.title: best friends, ex-friends 'til the end (better off as lovers)
entry.summary:
Author: drakesword

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,245Chapters: 8/40Kudos: 21

Summary: A lot of things are gay at this school, Eddie has noticed. It’s not necessarily a new phenomenon, but back in elementary school, that word was only ever hushed, giggled over, never dared to be said in front of the teachers, in fear of being scolded.Here, however, it’s shouted down hallways, said out loud in classrooms, written on blackboards, thrown at the heads of kids who dare to express themselves in the wrong way.So yeah, no thanks. Eddie would rather not approach, or even look at anyone with something remotely close to a social life at this school again. He doesn’t want to make himself a target.Because if there is one thing people should know about him, it’s this: Eddie Diaz is not gay. Or; AU where Buck and Eddie meet in middle school and quickly become best friends. But is that really all they are?

entry.title: Never Let Me Go ( A Sinner Like Me)
entry.summary:
Author: colescharms

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,053Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 107

Summary: When infamous rockstar Evan “Buck” Buckley gets injured (again), his label hires Army vet-turned-EMT Eddie Diaz to shadow him on tour. Eddie’s job is simple: keep Buck breathing. But nothing about Buck is simple—not his smile, not his secrets, and definitely not the way he starts to feel like home.Eddie’s supposed to keep Buck safe. Buck’s supposed to stay out of trouble. But somewhere between motel parking lots, midnight emergency calls, and songs that sound too much like confessions, lines blur—and hearts get caught in the wreckage.This tour might save Buck’s career. It might ruin Eddie’s life. Or maybe, if they’re lucky, it could be the start of something louder than either of them expected.

entry.title: Gone With the Current
entry.summary:
Author: Lalagirl92

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,321Chapters: 5/12Kudos: 109

Summary: When Buck feels increasingly isolated and unappreciated by the 118, he begins to pull away, believing they've already given up on him. During a dangerous rescue, tragedy strikes — Buck is swept away and presumed dead. His apparent loss shatters the team, forcing them to confront the guilt, regrets, and emotional distance they had let grow between them.But Buck survives — alive, injured, and with no memory of who he is.As the 118 grieves and struggles to move forward, fate brings them back to Buck. Rebuilding trust isn’t easy, especially when Buck doesn’t remember the pain — or the love — that once bound them. Now, they must earn their second chance… before it’s too late.

entry.title: I Never Needed You Like I Do Right Now
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_stan

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,770Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 15

Summary: Buck was spiraling again. It had been 3 days since Bobby had passed. It was the longest 3 days of Buck's life. Sometimes he finds himself dialing Bobby's number. Leaving him voicemails about how angry he was. How much he hated that he left. It was all the same feelings. Just in different words. The night Bobby died, Buck came home alone. It was dark, and cold. Lonely too. He wanted Eddie. He needed someone to be there for him. Cause while everyone else went home to their families that night. Buck was alone. Crying on the floor of his bedroom. No one to comfort him. He wanted to call Eddie. But he didn't. They didn't speak until the 3rd day. Buck knew he was getting closer to the edge everyday that passed. Everyday he had to sit at the dinner table alone.

entry.title: When Two world colide nothing can go wrong...right?
entry.summary:
Author: Zamiyah

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,022Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: In the moonlit grandeur of Castle Nocturne, Prince Buck learns his fate has been sealed—his parents, King Bobby and Queen Athena, have arranged a political marriage without his consent. Furious at being treated like a pawn, Buck storms out, desperate for control over his own future. Seeking refuge in his sister Maddie's chambers, he vents his outrage, only to have a reckless plan take shape after a joking comment from her husband, Chimney. If Buck is already married, he reasons, his parents can't force the alliance.Spurred by defiance and desperation, Buck flees to the enchanted garden and demands the portal show him his destined lover. When the swirling magic reveals the sleeping face of a stranger—Eddie Diaz—Buck smiles, his plan clear.If his fate is to be taken from him, then he'll steal a new one for himself.or another buddie fantasy au

entry.title: Tree pose gone wrong
entry.summary:
Author: headinthecloudsgirl

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 544Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 53

Summary: Buck. Yoga. A lack of coordination. And Eddie, who definitely didn’t mean to watch the whole thing.Buck is mid-pose. Sweating. Shirtless.Legs too long. Shorts too short.Back arched in a way that absolutely should not be legal before 10 a.m.Stretching and he’s muttering.Not like a mantra. More like… “Okay, okay, you’ve got this, don’t fall, don’t fall, fuck—” I mean, the fact that Eddie can just let himself into Buck's loft does have a lot of potential for unexpected situations :D
